intro: Senecio famatinensis, commonly known as the Famatinian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family.
